item.title: React & TypeScript: how to type hooks (a complete guide)
item.description: Hooks are a fundamental aspect of writing React components, so knowing how to type them is vital to using TypeScript with React. Let's see how to do that!

item.title: React & TypeScript: use generics to improve your types
item.description: TypeScript generics in React are very useful, but can be scary when you don't know how they work. This article will help you understand generics and how to use them in React.

item.title: How to use React useReducer hook like a pro
item.description: The React useReducer hook is another way to manage state in components. But do you know when to use it vs useState, and how? We'll learn that (and more) in this article.

item.title: How to use React Context like a pro
item.description: React Context can be a very powerful tool, and there are several tricks to using it effectively. Several patterns can be used to empower your context use.

item.title: React events and TypeScript: a complete guide
item.description: Learn how to handle onClick, onChange, and many other events on React with TypeScript. It's a bit harder than you'd think but easy once you know how to do it!

item.title: How to add keyboard shortcuts to your React app
item.description: Adding keyboard shortcuts to a React app can empower your users to use it more effectively, and it's pretty simple! We'll see how to do it in this article.

item.title: How to use async functions in useEffect (with examples)
item.description: Using asynchronous functions in a useEffect hook is quite common, notably for data fetching. Let's see several ways of going about it!

item.title: What are dependency arrays in React?
item.description: If you want to use functional components in React, you'll have to deal with dependency arrays. Do you know how to use them and what purpose they serve?

item.title: How to set an interval in React (with examples)
item.description: setInterval allows us to schedule an action in the future. It's often very useful in web apps. Let's see how to set it up in React apps.

item.title: How to set a timeout in React (with examples)
item.description: setTimeout allows us to schedule an action in the future. It's often very useful in web apps. Let's see how to set it up in React apps.

item.title: How to sleep in JavaScript?
item.description: Have you ever wanted your JavaScript code to pause for a certain amount of time? Here's how to do it!
